DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Pharmacologic Substance First Level Integer::0 Decimal Place Microgram per Milliliter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place microgram per milliliter numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the first level for the drug administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Pharmacologic Substance First Level
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b))._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic substance including endogenous body substance used to diagnose, prevent, maintain, treat or analyze abnormal and normal biological functions in vivo or in vitro.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.  (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 0 Decimal Place Microgram per Milliliter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A metric unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one gram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic meter. The concept also refers to the metric unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one gram occupies the volume of one cubic meter._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Microgram per Milliliter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:The metric unit of mass concentration defined as the  concentration of one gram of a substance in unit volume of the mixture  equal to one cubic meter. The concept also refers to the metric unit of  mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of substance which  mass equal to one gram occupies the volume one cubic meter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

A metric unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one gram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one cubic meter. The concept also refers to the metric unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one gram occupies the volume of one cubic meter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
